intro: Eriogonum vimineum var. divergens, commonly known as the redstem filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its basal leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and often appear in late spring to early summer. The variety divergens is distinguished by its more spreading growth habit and slightly different leaf morphology compared to the typical form.
